list_definition.definition: the poison produced by some snakes, scorpions etc, transmitted by biting or stinging

list_ex_of_english: As already noted, stingray spines apparently continue to retain venom for some time after becoming detached from the animal.
Differences in venom composition may play a role in the effectiveness of the medicinal plants used for snakebites.
To put this into perspective, though, deaths from mollusc venoms are less than 10% of the number of deaths from jellyfish stings.
The venoms contain many different toxins that vary in their effects; some are extremely toxic.

Snake venoms are complex mixtures of proteins, and are stored in poison glands at the back of the head.
Two broad classes of toxins found in snake venoms are neurotoxins (mostly found in elapids) and hemotoxins (mostly found in viperids).
Also, some venoms include a proteolytic component that aids in digestion.
